title: How Historically Accurate Is ‘Once Upon a Time … in Hollywood’? Plus: Amazon’s Next Move and Celebrating the Music of 1999 | The Watch
description:
There was a lot of news out of the TCAs this weekend, including what Amazon wants its streaming service to look like over the next few years (2:43). After Netflix canceled the critically acclaimed ‘Tuca and Bertie,’ the metric of success in the streaming world is called into question yet again (17:15). Plus: How historically accurate is ‘Once Upon a Time … in Hollywood’ (26:00)? And our favorite music from 1999 (39:20)

Host: Chris Ryan
Guests: Alison Herman, Kate Knibbs, and Lindsay Zoladz

Spoilers for ‘Once Upon a Time ... in Hollywood’ in the second half of this episode.

      
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
